system.biography:
TitleFFF 804g Gargun Warrior
Birthday
AppearanceAge unknown, height 9’11”, Huge frame (size 10), weight 410 lb, pallid appearance, black hair, black eyes.
Medical/PsycheGigantism, Addiction (Severe: test WIL×1 to withstand stopping to ingest Arva and Doshenkana). Pyrophobia (Severe: test WIL×1 to stand against threatening flames and heat).
Size0
ArmorPlain cloth girdle. Huge mankar.
Other EquipmentFly-covered bast, Arva, and Doshenkana wadded into a ball and tucked away under his girdle.
Valuables
NotesBorka’s age is purposefully kept unknown as a plot hook for pHarn campaigns. The giant may not have a life span comparable to other gargun. His environment has not encouraged his development, nor does he benefit from the standard gargun genetic skills set. With Mankar: May attack all persons in engagement zone (10 ft reach; 2 hexes out from hex) within 180 degrees of facing. No follow-through on hits with an amputation and/or knockback result for each hit. Also, the attack must move in one direction only for the sweep. Each target imposes a cumulative –10% to attack; too many targets throws off Borka's aim.

Biography

Borka’s origins are unknown. His first memories are of a man in robes periodically inspecting him and others of his kind, culling those that appeared weak, malformed, or mentally aberrant. Borka and his kin were subjected to spells by the robed man and forced by his Araki cronies to drink vile potions and ingest herbs. While most died, Borka and a few others grew large and strong. They were kept chained up and released only to fight each other, until only Borka remained. Borka’s life was one of constant violence, pain from being tortured with burning brands, and dread of the robed man whose very glance caused the gargun to grovel and mewl at his feet.

One day, the wizard’s sanctum was attacked. Confused and frightened by the fire and smoke, Borka broke his chains and escaped into the wilderness. He wandered far, hiding from the burning sun and searching for food at night. Eventually, he found other gargun. Impressed by Borka’s great size and strength, a wily king enticed him to join his hive. The orcs regularly provide Borka with large quantities of meat, but he goes out alone to secretly find the herbs that he craves. The experiments performed on Borka as a youth have left him dependent on Arva and Doshenkana to maintain his health and mind.

Borka’ fearsome fighting prowess has ensured his colony’s success against gargun, barbarian, and feudal lord alike. These successes, however, are starting to worry his king, who fears the giant may aspire to lead the hive. Some in the colony complain bitterly of the huge amount of meat and sausage Borka eats. It is only a matter of time before the king or a group of disgruntled gargun attempt to assassinate Borka. Certainly, copious amounts blood will flow in the ensuing battle.

HOOKS

Bitter Herbs. The PCs are herb hunting in the woods when they see Borka foraging at the same herb patch. The giant is pulling up great handfuls of foliage and greedily stuffing them into his mouth. He wouldn’t mind supplementing his meal with some fresh meat, however.

The One That Got Away. In the presence of the PCs, a knight recounts a dreadful tale of how a monster had burst from the woods late one night and struck the forequarters of his warhorse clean off with the sweep of a huge sword. The knight was thrown off into the brush and saw the great beast carry away the bloody remains of his horse. He will be quick to challenge those who scoff.

Mabresen’s Monster. A child-sized figure concealed head to toe in robes approaches the PCs and offers them coin if they can succeed in tracking down and capturing Borka for Mabresen (FFF13 704a).

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
